meanings.definition: Taxies: the plural form of the noun 'taxi', meaning a vehicle used to transport passengers for a fare.
meanings.sent1: The taxies lined up outside the airport were all yellow.
meanings.sent2: I took one of the taxies waiting outside the train station.
meanings.sent3: The competition between the two taxies for customers was fierce.
meanings.sent4: The fleet of taxies in the city resembled a colorful parade.
meanings.sent5: The sound of honking taxies filled the busy streets.

meanings.definition: Taxies: the third person singular form of the verb 'taxi', meaning to move an aircraft on the ground under its own power.
meanings.sent1: The airplane taxies slowly towards the runway.
meanings.sent2: The pilot expertly taxies the plane to the gate after landing.
meanings.sent3: The tiny toy plane taxies around the miniature airport.
meanings.sent4: The aircraft taxies gracefully, guided by the ground crew.
meanings.sent5: The plane taxies smoothly, ready for takeoff.
